    PCA Plot

    plot_pca.Rd

    A convenience function for plotting PCA scatter plot for samples in ExpressionSet/MSnSet object. The biplot is essentially the ggplot version of biplot.prcomp.

    plot_pca(
  eset,
  phenotype = NULL,
  label = NULL,
  z_score = TRUE,
  show_ellipse = TRUE,
  components = 1:2,
  biplot = FALSE,
  biplot_labels = NULL,
  standardize = TRUE,
  num_features = 6L,
  show_NA = TRUE,
  legend_title = phenotype,
  arrow_args = list(),
  label_args = list(),
  ...
)

    Arguments

    eset

    eset (or most likely eset subclass) object.

    phenotype

    NULL or string; one of colnames(pData(eset)). This is used to color the points or labels, if label is not NULL. Default is NULL, which colors all points or labels black.

    label

    NULL or string; one of colnames(pData(eset)). If a string is provided, labels will be used instead of points.

    z_score

    logical; whether to convert values to Z-Scores by sample. Default is TRUE.

    show_ellipse

    logical; whether to show the confidence ellipses if phenotype is not NULL.

    components

    numeric; a vector of length two specifying the principal components to plot. Default is c(1, 2), which plots PC1 on the x-axis and PC2 on the y-axis. Order matters.

    biplot

    logical; whether to display the biplot.

    biplot_labels

    NULL or string; the name of a column in fData(eset) used to label the biplot features. If NULL (default), featureNames(eset) is used.

    standardize

    logical; if TRUE (default), the feature loadings and scores are scaled in opposite directions by the standard deviations of the principal components. This will produce a biplot similar to biplot.prcomp. If FALSE, the result will be similar to biplot.default.

    num_features

    numeric; the number of most influential features from each principal component to label. Default is 6.

    show_NA

    logical; whether to include samples with missing phenotype information. Default is TRUE.

    legend_title

    string; title of the plot legend. Defaults to phenodata.

    arrow_args

    a list of arguments passed to geom_segment to modify the biplot arrows.

    label_args

    a list of arguments passed to geom_label_repel to modify the biplot labels.

    ...

    additional arguments passed to geom_point or geom_text, such as size and pch.

    Value

    A ggplot object

    Examples

    library(MSnSet.utils)
data(cptac_oca)

# Default plot
plot_pca(oca.set)
#> Subsetting to 4738 complete rows for PCA.


# Color by SUBTYPE with custom legend title
plot_pca(oca.set, "SUBTYPE", legend_title = "Subtype")
#> Subsetting to 4738 complete rows for PCA.


# Color by SUBTYPE and label by Batch
plot_pca(oca.set, phenotype = "SUBTYPE", label = "Batch")
#> Subsetting to 4738 complete rows for PCA.


# Biplot
plot_pca(oca.set, biplot = TRUE)
#> Subsetting to 4738 complete rows for PCA.
